page.title: 11L. A. WILES AND SON
page.content: My family own a small business which started trading during the 1930s. At that time the work was mainly motor engineering and cycle repairs. The business continued through the next thirty years mostly unchanged and during the early 1970s was very much involved in the sale of new cars and motor cycles. Because of a general decline in living standards and the consequent reduction of car sales, it was at this time that the company diversed into general steel fabrication and the garage content disposed of. 1975-82 saw a large demand for steel storage containers for domestic heating oil etc. and at the height of this period some 3000 units per year were produced and delivered to all parts of the U.K.
